channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cable hanging down from road sign on bridge, 9th July
item.description:
Advised by the NR helpline that a member of the public has reported a 3 pin 240v plug hanging down from the Ancient Foresters side of LBW84B, Southwark Park Road. The reporter is concerned that a lorry could come in to contact with the cable causing complications. NR staff sent to site and confirm the cable is connected with the height restriction sign and will need a cherry picker to reconnect. Signs are maintained by the council and NOT Network Rail

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, tyres deflating, attracting unwanted attention!, 9th July
item.description:
There is a van that is parked up on my estate, just now had some youths trying to break in the vehicle (registration EF62ZRX- white van). I don't feel safe with this vehicle parked up, clearly been left here, tyres are deflating, rubbish all left inside and has run out of MOT. I know it's been reported before but to be woken up by youths kicking the back of the van's doors, it is worrying for me and my elderly wife, we don't feel safe outside our own home. Kind Regards, John
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal bollard in road, 9th July
item.description:
A metal bollard has been vandalised, maybe someone has cut it from the bottom, not sure how it managed to break in the first place but it is now in the road, it is a safety hazard for cars and pedestrians, I feel it needs to be removed ASAP!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Bramcote Grove, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven & Cracked Paving Slabs, 8th July
item.description:
Albion Road at the junction with the Albion Road Multi-Storey Public Car Park (old Civic Offices Car Park), Bexleyheath: I reported this last year however no action was taken. Please could you replace the uneven and cracked paving slabs - picture attached.

item.title: Terrible smelling drain, 8th July
item.description:
We have for several years in the summer suffered from a terrible smelling drain. It’s the one closest to the junction with Acer Road and Holly Street. It’s absolutely disgusting and comes into both our bedroom and living area every night.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Acer Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Albert Westcott House needs cleaning, 8th July
item.description:
The ground floor of the building stinks after someone poured dirty water across it at the weekend. The floor is now stained and needs to be cleaned, as does the lift (which also smells) and all the windows opposite the lift doors on each floor of the building.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Walworth Road, Walworth, London
